indicators.name: ODA with gender objectives (%, DAC 1/2)
indicators.descriptor: Bilateral ODA share; law targets 75% by 2025
indicators.note: Focus 2030 (2025) confirms 2022 France DAC 1/2 share at 46%.

indicators.name: ODA with gender as principal objective (%, DAC 2)
Direct funding to feminist CSOs (USD M)
indicators.descriptor: Funding to women’s rights orgs/feminist movements/gender institutions
indicators.note: Focus 2030 (2025) figure for 2022–2023. OECD CSO channel proxy (USD 783.8M, 2022) kept in notes for reference.

indicators.name: FFP strategy status
indicators.note: 2018 strategy and 2021 Programming Law frame gender as cross-cutting; using 'embedded' to reflect inter-ministerial mainstreaming. See also meae_strategy_2018.

indicators.name: Gender-budget tagging across ministries
indicators.descriptor: Adoption level of gender-budget tagging in government budgeting
indicators.note: Placeholder — needs cross-ministry verification and audit reference.

indicators.name: Gender focal points coverage
indicators.descriptor: % of embassies/departments with appointed gender focal points
indicators.note: Placeholder — strategy cites a network of focal points; coverage share requires verification.

indicators.name: Staff trained on gender equality
indicators.descriptor: % of staff completing required gender training
indicators.note: Placeholder — strategy mandates training; exact coverage rate to confirm.

indicators.name: Legal codification depth
indicators.descriptor: Level of codification across instruments (e.g., Programming Law 2021)
indicators.note: Placeholder — confirm external audit/oversight for top tier.

indicators.name: EU/G7 leadership on gender
indicators.descriptor: G7 Presidency (2019): GEAC extended; Biarritz Partnership

indicators.name: Leadership recency
indicators.descriptor: Leadership roles within the last 3 years
indicators.note: Placeholder — confirm any leadership roles within 2022–2024.

indicators.name: Continuity of multilateral initiatives
indicators.descriptor: Consistency sustaining gender initiatives across cycles
indicators.note: Proxy via continued GEF coalition work; verify breadth across fora.

penalties.name: Arms exports contradiction
penalties.note: Set to true only with substantiated evidence linking to WPS contradictions.

penalties.name: Aid budget cut (2024)
penalties.note: France announced ~€742M ODA reduction (~12.5%) in 2024, contradicting 0.7% GNI trajectory. Source: focus2030_fr_reneges_2025.

penalties.name: Climate ODA loan dominance (2022)
penalties.note: ~85% of climate ODA as loans (2022) per OECD DCP summary, indicating coherence risks. Source: oecd_dcp_france_profile_2024.
